p: SHUV infection and replication in biting midges seems more efficient compared to other biting midge-borne viruses such as SBV and Bluetongue virus (BTV), which generally result in infection rates up to 30% [ 31â€“ 35]. Both SBV and BTV have caused sudden and large-scale epizootics in Europe, with devastating consequences for the livestock sector [ 36, 37]. The relatively high SHUV transmission potential by biting midges and ongoing emergence of SHUV to areas outside Sub-Saharan Africa [ 13], should therefore be interpreted as a warning for its epizootic potential.
